articles.title: GM temporarily shuts down North American factories because of chip shortage - The Verge
articles.description: GM is temporarily shutting down nine of its North American factories as the auto industry continues to feel the effects of the global semiconductor chip shortage. Many of the company’s most profitable vehicles, including trucks and SUVs, are affected.
articles.content:
The situation remains complex and very fluid

articles.title: Chip shortage forces GM to extend factory closures - CBC.ca
articles.description: General Motors Co. will reduce production at most North American assembly plants this month because of the ongoing semiconductor chip shortage, hitting its profitable truck and sport utility vehicles, it said on Thursday.

articles.title: More than 500000 U.S. children tested positive for COVID-19 in 3 weeks - CTV News
